titleStmt.title: Hugh Mosher Estate Inventory in Dartmouth: a digital transcription

publicationStmt.p: Christopher A. Mosher, Shelton, CT, USA, 2018.

sourceDesc.bibl: County of Bristol (Massachusetts, USA), [Probate] Records, No. 3, 1710–1721, 173, inventory, Hugh Mosher, recorded 8 Dec 1713; digital images, Probates, v. 1–4 1687–1723, FHL microfilm 461,882, DGS 7703530, item 3, image 404 of 745.

body.p:
A true Inventory of all & singular the Goods Chattels & Credits of
Hugh Mosher of the Town of Dartmouth yeoman Deceased praised
in Dartmouth this
Tenth day of Nouember 1713
by Ionathan Davil
and Ebenezer Tripp the subscribers as it was presented to their
veiw and in the Possession of Sarah Mosher and by her shewed
to vs & apprised as followeth — — — — — — —
body.head: ImprsImprimis—

row.cell: His Purss & weering Apparrill

To Debts due by bonds from persons in the Colony
of Rhode Island Amounting to the sum of — }
Bibles and other Bookes all at — —

To money due in the hands of his Attorrny Daniel
Sebeere of Newport— — — — — }
His Dwelling house and land belonging to it at —
To 2 Cowes at — — — — — — —
To a horse at — — — — — — — —
To a percell of Hay at — — — — — —
To three Swine at — — — — — —
To Carpenters Tools and a percell of old Iron —
Bed steads Corn and Tobacca — —

To a few shovel & two pair of Tongs & 3 tramels
& two iron Polls and Kettle at — — — — }
To a pair of Stillards and a spit at—
To a percell of Pewter and Brass & one lanthorn at —
To Beding — — — — — — — — — —
silluer plate all at— — — — — — —
To a Chest a Desk & scales & weights — — —
To Tables Chaires & a forme at — — — —
To a Warming Pann Looking Glass and a Morter — —
To a percell of Barlls. wheeles Tubbs & a sadle — —
To a percell of Glass Bottles — — — — —
To a Grindston at — — — — — — — —

An accot of what moueable estate he had wth his wife
in Marriage and Brot to Dartmouth is as followeth
To a bed and beding and furniture & Bedsteed — —
To a Case of Drawers a Trunk and a Chest at —
To fiue Earthen Panns & one Earthen plate — —

To two pewter plates & three pewter platters Two
Porringers a pewter bason 2 old Chamberpotts & a skillett }
To an Iron Pot Pot hooks three washing Tubbs & 2 meat Carbls

This Inventory Amounting to the sum of Two Hundred
& Ninety pounds seventeen shillings & Two pence
errors excepted apprized as abouesaid by us Ionath Davel
Ebenezer Tripp

body.p:
Bristol ss
December þethe 7th 1713
in Bristol
Then Iames Mosher and Daniel Sabeer executors of the last
will and Testament of MrMister Hugh Mosher late of Dartmouth Deceased
Before the Honrable Nathal Paine Esqr Iudge of Probate &cet cetera within
the County abouesd And made Oath that the Inventory aboue written
containes the whole of that estate the sd Deceased Dyed seizedof &
is come to their knowledge & when they know of any more they
will Reveal it
Nathal Paine
Iohn Cary Register

Entered
Decembr 8th 1713
By Iohn Cary Register
